transcript.content: This is really annoying. They're going to be... ah no.
He's thinking, he's already done the trampoline, my pogo stick act is never gonna work!
Yeah go on, so there's a hippo waiting, eh- this, this- see it's a great story and I just know he embellishes it or he gets slightly wrong, go on.
So there's a midget jumping up and down...
The midget's loving it, can't believe his luck. Although we think- you think he probably knows he's dicing with danger.
They're all saying "Higher, higher", he gives it one big, like, heavy sort of landing on the trampoline, goes really high. But, goes off at a funny angle...
Yeah? Umm, and sort of flies at-
Ricky bursts out laughing, then Steve
Flies off at a funny angle...
Crowd are clapping, thinking "That's why the hippo was waiting there".
Steve laughs louder, Ricky joins him

But n- nooo, maybe the- there was an accident in a, uhh, a circus with a midget and a hippo eat him, but at no point was this hippo waiting to go on going "Come on", the midget flew off at a hypotenuse, and landed in the hippo's mouth and was swallowed whole!
This is- this is what you embellished- that is great, and what's that-
I have to say though, Rick, when I heard: midget, trampoline, hippot- hippopotamus, I was thinking 'accident waiting to happen'.
It is uh, that- that- that- you should never put those three together.
It's a- it's a recipe for disaster-
Everyone knows that. "Midget, trampoline, hippopotamus? Are you mental?!"
You know when he told me it, he said "And the midget", he didn't mention the hippopotamus, and he said "the midget went higher and higher, and soon he fell off, and the Hippo eat him."
And I said "Sorry? What was the hippo doing there?" He went "It's a circus."
I've never heard of a circus having a hippo?!
What can they do? You can't train them, can you?
You can't have a hippo in a circus! You're not thinking of Zippo?
He did- he- no ye no- an- and- It wasn't, it wasn't, it wasn't some sort of- where Zippo was 'eating a midget' and it's some sort of horrible sexual act?
No it was defin- I heard it on Breakfast, right? And, definitely-
No, it's definitely fact, then, it's definitely truth.
Yeah, okay, right, okay, good. Uhh, let's play a record then.
104.9, I'm Ricky Gervais, uh, with me Stephen Merchant-
Uh, it's the best-of. You've been voting in all week, sending your emails, so here's the clips that you wanted.
We- we- me and Karl went out, right? Um, and uhh, uh with, um, me and Jane and Karl and Johnny and Gigi, wasn't it?
But we're walking down the street. Karl was there though and he can back me up on this. Um, we'd had a curry, we're walking back, and uhh, this little funny homeless fella, didn't he?
He, er- oh I gotta tell it before-fore I go "didn't he?"
So the mother was a right pig, apparently. I don't know where that's...
Well, you don't need to go that far.
But what I'm trying to do is, like, make a picture for you so you understand...
And what a picture it is.
Who did she look like? Who did she look like?
Okay. I knew you were gonna say that. I knew it was gonna be Pauline. Did she have any tats? Did she have any tattoos?
I never got that close to her.
So, and so, who had the horse? Was this her son or her husband?
Her daughter had stolen a horse?
Yeah. From... I don't know where. There was... I think there was some stables down the road or something.
And they kept the horse in the house with them?
They kept it in the house. They didn't have it for long.
Sorry, and you said you were in the house one day and you saw the horse in there?

No, what happened was, um, they did this thing at school about raising money for charity, right? For some local charity. And they said you can do anything to raise money and they came out with all these ideas and I thought that's good.
But forget... well, I dunno. I thought 'forget the charity'. I'm the charity here.
Yeah, it's just a good money-making... (laughing) You're a charity?
So, I asked me mam for some - she used to have a lot of flowers round the house.
I said, 'Can I just take some snippings of them? And I'll go and buy some plastic cups?' And uh, got some soil out the garden, planted the bits of plants in them.
Did you just cut... you didn't just cut them and stick them in soil did you?
But I think people sort of thought, 'Well, good on him for trying.' But anyway, so I went round to theirs, because I thought, 'Their house could do with a bit of colour and stuff.'
Because it's a bit rough. So as I went...
The horse went, 'Thank God for that, breakfast! They've been feeding me Kit E Kat."
So I got up to the door, and they opened the door, and it was one of them houses where... no carpet.
(laughing) Yeah... a horse in the living room.
And the horse was walking round the living room. And it looked quite happy and everything, because I always say that about animals, right?
Well, think about it, right? If you were a horse, where would you rather be - in a little wooden hut with a load of hay, or in, like, a house with a...
No, but I was saying this the other day...
I was walking through London the other day...
Walking through London with Suzanne, right?
And do you know how, like, homeless people always have dogs?
And she said, 'Ooh, I hope she looks after it.' And I said, 'They've got... that dog is happier than most dogs.'
Because people always walk past and give it a pat on the head.
With it's owner all the time.
It's out in the open, it's not locked up in a house.
It doesn't eat, but other than that.
No, it does eat, though! They're always alright. So that's what I was saying, I think this horse was doing alright for itself.
(laughing) Well, not many horses have got their own house, for a start. Yeah.
So anyway, this family, who's a bit... what were we talking about? It was about cloning...
Genetically modified kids and all that stuff, yeah.
Right, now, what I'm saying is, you could say... you know, right Steve, you could have a baby and Ricky could see it and say, 'God, I want one that looks like that.'
So you take it to the doctor's. And I dunno what they do with it, they inject it with something or whatever.

And, uh, get a little baby and there it is. It looks the same. Now the thing is: You separate. You both go off and do your own things. Right. Now, you look at Ste- Steven, this is. You look after your baby.
You treat it well. You give it good food and that.
All the vitamins and stuff. Ricky just gives it cheese. Right.
Then it changes its looks. It goes a bit fat. You know, it gets tired easily and that sort of thing. Now, when this family-
Why am I just feeding a baby cheese?

Right, this, this, um, this, this, this family who had a horse in the g- in the, you know, in their house. They had a, a little baby. And me mam went round and said, "You're not gonna believe this but it's a beautiful looking baby". Right. And I was like, "Well, you know". And, uh, the weird thing is it was a good looking kid. But as time went on they didn't really look after it, and I'm not
Saying like abusing it but it used to run around. It used to play out til like ten at night.
Uh, it used to chase cars.
It used to chase cars! What sort of kid chases cars?!
Oh, God! Was it called Rover?
Now, the weird thing is it was a good looking kid but as time went on and all that, like, not eating properly and its hair was all
It's not Liam Gallagher is it?
And chasing cars and that and it became an ugly kid.
And that's- that's what I'm saying, right. You can cl- you can clone all you like but at the end of the day it's how you're brought up.
That was a hell of a point!
I'm Ricky Gervais. With me, Steve and Karl. Karl, why have you got a headache? You got a headache?
Stressful cos the move's- move's on this, uh, this week.
Oh by the way, uh, the Xfm listeners came round to me house and bought the, uh, futon and table.
Quite normal. They were well happy.
Couldn't believe their luck with it.
What do you mean, 'quite normal'? What do you mean, 'quite normal'?
Well it's always a bit scared init, getting, getting people round.
And were they excited to see you? Could they- I mean they were- You know, could you tell that they were pretty pleased to see you?
No I don't think so. I mean, you know-
Yeah but I- The- the fella sort of, I mean they brought their whole family round. Which was a bit odd.
Well it's not often they get the chance to, to visit a living freak.
Anyway. Anyway, they were- they were nice. They were nice.

And you're moving now are ya? He said- he phoned me up today. You know it was absolutely tipping it down. He had to cycle in cos he said cos of the move he doesn't wanna leave his bike round there. Right, and he said
It was like, it was like that sort of Slither film where that bloke had loads of tellys watching peoples lives.

So that was going on in my mind and then I was washing up and I picked up the plate and I thought it's amazing innit the human body. The way you can just sort of, you know, "I wanna pick that up" and you do.
And the way your hands work, right, you've got five little digits but it's just the right amount to-
To do what you've gotta do? Right? So so I'm washin-
Ricky interrupts and bursts out laughing

Sorry Karl, stop, "it's just the right amount" might be one of the most genius things I've ever heard said. I would love David Attenborough to phone you up and say "Karl how do i word this, about the evolution of the mammalian front limb?", "well just say it's the right amount"
It is. Of course it is.
One extra would get in the way and one less would make it just that little bit more tricky when picking up a bit of a slippery dish.
So then I was thinking, alright, imagine like going the doctors and they say "yeah everything's alright, your 'earts good and everything but"
Your arts good? What your Lowrys or?
"Your heart, your heart, your in good form and what have you, it's good news, I had Jono in earlier, he's not looking good"
"But you're alright but your hands need to come off"
Right, blimey, that's bad luck. I'd get a second opinion initially.
"But a bit of good news, I've got a nice pair of feet I can sort you out with"
He puts them on, and then I was thinking right first of all: washing up what would that be like?
That would be tricky. And then the second thing was it would probably ruin the sort of shape of your jumper.
Because you'd have to keep putting your feet through there.
And then I thought but I could still cycle in to work-
Well that's what I was thinking, I thought, I could still cycle because I could balance.
And then I thought but the only thing is I probably couldn't pull the brakes.
Because of the little short things.
And then like you I thought but then again you're running in half time. So that's what was going on last night.
That's what I was thinking about.
Well, how long does it take to wash up?
Right, because I imagine you just being there for like, all night.
How long did the little Chinese fella dance for in his pants?
Last night he was at it for like 10 minutes. And his girlfriend never sits in the same room as him, she's always sat in the bedroom-
She's going "you dance in pants again I'm going next door"
Well she was in the bedroom, she's always in the bedroom sat on the floor, on the mobile phone
Yeah, all the time. It's weird how peoples lives are just like, it is like that Groundhog Day thing, it's like, he's jumping about in his underpants, the old woman's sat there reading a book.
And that's what got me thinking about my life-
Are you sure she's not dead?
Every time you look down there, she's just flicking through the- she's just reading this book! The pages never turn, she never seems to finish it!
She never moves from her chair!
Are you sur- are you sure the Chinese girl's goin-
Her cats are dead around her!
"I- I- I'm going into next door again, that little round-headed fella's...
...looking in! He's looking in at me!" And the bouncer goes, "Don't worry love, I'll go and beat him up."
They se- they see you staring at them washing up going, "I could have feet here." And they get scared...
Karl, can you tell us roughly
Which neighborhood you live in, so- so that we know?
Wow, imagine if that little d- was he a Chinese fella, did you say?
Imagine if he was listening now, I'd love him to call in and explain these actions.
Well he- he might be on some other radio station talking about a lad who's always washing up and-
-looking at his hands in a mysterious way.
But, do we kn- this doctor, this doctor that would go, "well alright Karl, I've got- you can either leave them as stumps, or I've got a lovely little pair of feet." Why u-u-uh, I mean
I t-told Jane this and Jane went, "Did- hh- is that the only choice? Did he- could you say, 'Could I have some dead man's hands?'"
"Have you got any- ha- if you've- where'd you get the feet from? Where'd you get the feet from? Can I have- can I have pa-". What would you rather have then, human feet or monkey paws?
Mpff, when I- I mean that wasn't an option last night, d-
No it wasn't an option last night, but don't forget it's in your head Karl, this didn't happen. This is-
No but, I'm just saying at the time that's all the doctor had to offer.
But you know it's your head, you can go anywhere- no no no, it wasn't a real doctor to offer, it's in your head,
You can go anywhere. You-you're not trapped.
Yeah but if you can do anything then you'd say, "Well sort us out some other hands."
Fair point, let's play a record.
Ah, you're listening to the best of, basically Karl Pilkington.
Sound effect of a tape loading
Right, are you ready then? So, uhh, just in case, uh, you haven't heard it before, I give you some initials of a band or an artist...
We're not doing Rockbusters now, are we?
Yeah I thought- well we've just-
Ah they- w- k-keep that going then, we go- why d- I-I love Educating Ricky, that's my favourite thing now.
Well w-what d'you wanna do Steve? I mean it's just, it's just-
I think let's- let's- let's- let's- hear the clues!
It's just that you've- i-it's, it's sort of bigged up the prizes and people will be-
And so, this is only by email. Give the email address out now, for people to write it down now Karl.
You're gonna get three clues, you've gotta get them all right...
And you win all the stuff.
You win all those prizes we said, okay Karl go on then.
Right, and just a quick example, uh, the f- one of the first ones we did, it was like 'A.K.', and the clue was "Exploding Pet"-
So, you understand how it works now, these are your clues, the first one, ummm: 'That army has got some well nice
'That army has got some well nice trenches.' Excellent.
Yep, and the initials there are: D.W.
Do you write some of the questions for Fifteen to One?
So, 'That army has got some well-
What were the initials there, Karl, on that first one?
Yep. Right, uh, the second one: 'The top of them curtains are all wrecked; all the material's all worn.'
Ricky and Steve howl with laughter
We've got to get him on telly, we have got to get him on telly because his little face, and his, his gestures, and-

Okay that's the second one, the initials being HV. Okay, the top of those curtains are wrecked. All the material's all worn out, right, HV.  And the final one, um, here's the final clue. I was in Texas the other week, alright, I tripped and landed on my knees in a puddle.
Initials WH for that one. So I was in Texas tripped up, landed on my knees in a puddle, so that's WH.

Okay, tell me during the record, tell me during it- Remember you're playing for, uh, these compilation albums. We got the Fatboy Slim DVD, Linda Green on VHS and, of course, Executive Decision. Starring Kurt Russell as well.
XFM 104.9 Ricky Gervais, Stephen Merchant. We're not actually here, um, it's the Best Of. (tape rewinding)
Okay, what's the next one? What's the next Educating Ricky?
Well, I don't know, uh... see like I say I was looking around in this stuff that... is interesting, alright. I was looking on the web-
Well it's just that I found one about uh-
-about a lad who, uh... eight years old, but he still breastfed.
Now, I don't know if you can get anything out of that.
Is that what his mum said? What do you mean you don't know if I can get anything out of that, you don't need to.
You're always unspecific when you mention it, it's just "it was on the internet".
Yeah. Well I'm trying to think what I put in, I think I put in "why" to see if I'd confuse a computer.

I did a search, put in "why," and it came up with funny things, like why is this person doing that, why is that-  and it had a picture of this eight year old lad, sort of, you know, on his mum's nipple, and it was saying, is this healthy?
You sure that wasn't asking you that question?
"I put in why, just to confuse the computer." It'll go, what do you mean?

Oh yeah, last week I was walking home with him and I went, uh, he was saying summat stupid, and I went, I've got a competition for next week. Let's do a phone in, and it's called "Karl Pilkington: Genius or Fool?"
Right. And he went. No... no.
I went, why not? He went well, it'd be confusing because they say, there's no difference between genius and being a fool.
No, no. No, it's rubbish. And people say, there's a fine line between madness and genius. And, you know, it's a ridiculous sound bite.  They don't say there's a fine line between genius and an idiot.
Well the people who do are idiots.
What would you do there though? Just to sort of wrap that little thing up, what would you do there? Lad loves his mum.
Another time, and he had shorts on, uh...

...at a similar event, and I've seen him since in the street and he's all- I don't think... I'm wondering if he can wear trousers. I don't think he can actually wear trousers, I don't know if there's a medical reason for that. Whether he's just...
I think the material is a waste of money, I think it's just-
-that, you can get shorts that big and they're comfortable and uh, y'kno- what'dya- I mean, to be quite honest w- wa- I don't wanna squeeze into a tuxedo anyway.
So, uh, if you can go- I'd love to turn up to those things in Bermuda shorts.
D'you think he started off by wearing- maybe just had the upper half was a tuxedo with the tie and the thing...
And then the shorts for comfort.
...and the shorts underneath, and he would just have to come in, to kind of sneak behind, d'you know a- a- a sideboard.
Or a potted plant. Or his kids, bring his kids ahead of him.
You know, "You are wearing trousers, aren't you?" "Yeah yeah yeah!"
"You are wearing trou-" "Course I am! Yeah, yeah, yeah"
Yeah! "In you go, in you go."
"they're- course I'm wearing trousers, why would I-"
And then he just thought, "well this isn't fooling anyone."
Yeah. "So I- now I'm gonna make a wacky effort to sort of, you know, s-"
The next Sony's, I've heard he's going in a grass skirt and a garland
And he's gonna- he's gonna come in limboing.
But you d- you did ask if you could go to the BAFTA's in a dressing gown.
But um, right there's this- talking about diets and stuff, right?
They've come up with a drug that, umm... They- they tested it out on a mouse, right?
They sa- they said, you know, it's a problem that weight- weight is a big issue in the world and, you know, a lot of people are depressed and that, probably like Rik Waller, like...
Well I'm depressed looking at Rik Waller.
I mean you cou- you could sort out Rik by...
You know, Jono is an old man, he's got loads of money...
No but he's getting on a bit, right...
He's about my age, you f-!
No but w- hang on a minute! What I mean is he does his own shopping, right? So, I bet it's hard-
Because, he's like, uh, how old is he? Thirty five, right?

He's got loads of money, he does his own shopping, so when he goes to the supermarket and he passes, you know, the- the sponge cake section, it must be tough when you've got loads of money to burn that you go "Oh, just one more."
Na-! I- I- ju- just, sor-! We are getting close to libel here I think.
I've tried, like, losing a little bit of weight...
...and it is difficult when you're, you know, you're in Waitrose and you see a little chocolate muffin and you think "Well..."
Do you like a little chocolate muffin now and again?
So the thing is, right- now with Rik, he lives a home with his mam, so why doesn't his mam just say, "I'm gonna buy less this week, and if you eat it all, you're not getting any more."
Does he live with his mum?
I bet he does, I bet he does.
So you- you don't actually know if this is true or not?
But anyway right, so this, this drug they've come up with, is...
They've tested this on mice, haven't they?
No I'm just- I'm worried if they haven't tested it on mice! Cause...
They're- it's definitely been tested on mouse.
But they- they fed a mouse a load of cake...
And it went a little bit chubby and they said, "Right, stop a minute." And then they gave it this drug-
And it- it's weight went down, but the only bad thing sign- side effect was it's eyes were popping out.
If he loses his head and is running around all over the place. You can't really count,
So they said, let's make a white line
Who said this? He did or they did?
I think they started to join in with them and saying let's make this a
Have they got Morris McWerther down? The Guinnes people.
So they said, let's get this white line.
And we'll do this tomorrow. He said: "alright then, I'll see you in the morning.
"See you in the morning!" "I'll see you in the morning!"
I love the fact that Karl knows exactly what was said.
He doesn't know the story or what order it's in, or when it was.
But he knows exactly what was said.
But he knows what the interviewer has said. "Alright then, see you in the morning." "Bye, little kissy-kissy-kissy-kissy."
Oh, I'm not like that. Oh you you joker.
Oh don't let the bed bugs bite!
Do you want the paper tomorrow? No I'm alright. Go on!
He gets up and they say right, you know today's the day an that.
And he said: you know, I've got used to the idea, so here's a white line for you.
So. So so they go, right, you ready then?
He said, alright, go on. So they cut his head off
And the body walked 32 steps without a head
And that's that's that's the lesson really
Did it get as far as to...It walked along the white line did it?
Yeah, it stayed along the white line, did 32 steps and then started to stumble a bit and then just fell over.
But you know it was a test that your body can still keep alive for a little bit. When you've lost your head.
What, what do you reckon you can do then without a head? How many steps?
Yeah. You could not distinctly take 32 steps. The body...
-sighs- Is the doctor still on the line? The fella that bought six parrots?
Right? So you don't beleive that
But something that you do beleive is that a cockroach can live a week without a head.
It can. Slightly different. Slightly different kettle of fish there.
Well, uhm insect to... a human.  Is what I'm thinking. That difference.
Yeah but there's not that much difference in some insects.
Do you know that a snake has a heart and lungs and kidneys and stuff?
You're making out as if either a totally different, like
I am, I am making that... call me old fashioned.
Do you know what you're talking about? I don't want you to embarass yourself, Rick.
Yeah, I am suggesting they're totally different beings. Yeah, that is. Yeah.
Now, Karl the cockroach is very different thing. The interesting thing there is that it lives without it's head because a lot of its on
There's some them phototropic, chemotropic, some of them just literally have
What is it? Uhh, soandsoso, therewascurtains, she went, "Oh right", said, "You know the thing around the top of the, uh, curtain is a pelmet, not a valence" and he went... cut her off.
Yeah but, my auntie's always making valences on everything, I'll tell you about that next week. Right? Right?
I'm looking forward to that story.
Is this the one that farted for five minutes?
Right, so, we'll talk about that. Uhh, "I was in Texas, I tripped up, I landed on me knees in a puddle." 'W.H.'
We've got Pete, Katherine and Laura in Newcastle-upon-Tyne, their listening online, I assume, and uh...

They're gonna get those great prizes, and remember they've got loads of stuff, they've got, uh, the DVD here, they've got Linda Green, got Stone Roses, they've got another compilation, and Executive Decision.
Where did you read about Brian Blessed? Is it actually true, or have you just libelled someone else-
No it was a- it was an interview, with him in it, talking about it.
Come on! What did he say?!
He said "I c- I climbed Everest and, uh, it played havoc with me belly." Let's talk about it next week.

synopsis.description: Diet Drug: Rik Waller vs Jono Colman shopping
Diet Drug: "It's eyes were popping out."
